decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to assemble the combo pieces, Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor, to create a loop that mills the entire deck. This allows the player to play the Thassa's Oracle and win the game on the spot. The deck utilizes counter spells like Daze and Force of Will, as well as disruption cards like Orim's Chant and Cabal Therapy to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes a toolbox with cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Urza's Saga to find and tutor for specific pieces of the combo.

The key concept of this deck is to use a combination of cards and spells to generate a large amount of mana and cards to fuel a storm count. The deck aims to cast spells like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Infernal Tutor to set up the perfect storm turn. It also includes cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and Lotus Petal to generate additional mana. The ultimate goal is to cast cards like Tendrils of Agony or Empty the Warrens to deal a large amount of damage or create a large number of tokens, respectively, and win the game in one explosive turn.

This deck revolves around the "Bomberman" combo, which involves using Auriok Salvagers and Lion's Eye Diamond to generate infinite mana. Phyrexian Devourer is used to exile cards from the library, becoming a massive creature that can deal lethal damage. The deck also includes cards like Walking Ballista and Karn, the Great Creator for additional combo potential and utility. To support the combo, the deck runs various artifacts like Chalice of the Void and Mox Opal, as well as disruption cards like Ethersworn Canonist and Rustvale Bridge. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly while controlling the opponent's game plan.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of lands and control spells. The deck focuses on using lands such as Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create powerful threats and control the opponent's mana base using cards like Ghost Quarter and Wasteland. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Sphere of Resistance and Swords to Plowshares to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also has access to cards like Mox Diamond and Exploration to accelerate its own mana production. Overall, the deck aims to maintain control of the game while gradually building up its own advantage.

This deck is focused on aggressive gameplay, aiming to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes powerful creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster, Legion Warboss, and Dragon tokens created by Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. The deck also utilizes disruptive elements like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Trinisphere to hinder the opponent's strategies. This deck aims to control the board with cards like Chalice of the Void and Fury while utilizing fast mana from cards like Ancient Tomb and Simian Spirit Guide. Overall, the key concept is to establish board dominance and quickly finish off the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to equip the Colossus Hammer onto a creature and deal a huge amount of damage in a single swing. The deck utilizes cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Steelshaper's Gift to tutor for the necessary equipment, while Puresteel Paladin reduces the equip cost and allows for card draw. The deck also includes support cards like Sigarda's Aid and Retrofitter Foundry to further optimize the combo. It aims to be fast and relentless, overwhelming opponents with the massive power of the Colossus Hammer.

The deck focuses on quickly and efficiently getting powerful creatures into play from the graveyard, utilizing cards like Shallow Grave, Exhume, and Animate Dead. It also utilizes tools like Lotus Petal and Dark Ritual to generate mana quickly, allowing for explosive turns. The deck is built to disrupt opponents' strategies, using cards like Unmask and Thoughtseize to strip their hand of key cards. The main win condition is to reanimate high-impact creatures like Griselbrand and Archon of Cruelty to gain card advantage and control the game.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay by utilizing artifacts with a blue color identity. It includes powerful artifact cards such as Mishra's Bauble, Mox Opal, and Urza's Saga to generate mana and provide advantage. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Metallic Rebuke and Force of Will to control the opponent's actions. Emry, Lurker of the Loch acts as a recurring threat, while Patchwork Automaton offers additional damage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient artifact creatures and disruptive spells while leveraging card draw through Thoughtcast.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Careful Study and Stinkweed Imp, then use cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Cephalid Coliseum to dredge and bring powerful cards from the graveyard into play. Bridge from Below and Narcomoeba are used to generate tokens and fuel the combo. The deck also uses cards like Cabal Therapy and Force of Will for disruption and protection. The goal is to create a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with the graveyard combo.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize cheap and efficient black creatures and disruption spells to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to quickly establish board presence with aggressive creatures like Grief, Dauthi Voidwalker, and Orcish Bowmasters while also disrupting the opponent's hand and graveyard with cards like Thoughtseize, Hymn to Tourach, and Opposition Agent. Additionally, the deck includes reanimation spells like Reanimate and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to cheat powerful creatures into play. The deck also features land destruction with Wasteland and Field of Ruin to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of creatures, spells, and lands. The deck focuses on ramping up mana through cards like Gaea's Cradle and Elves, while also using Green Sun's Zenith to search for key creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth and Allosaurus Shepherd. It also includes control elements like Bojuka Bog and Endurance to disrupt the opponent's strategies. Overall, the deck aims to establish board presence and outvalue the opponent through efficient creatures and strategic decision-making.

This deck is a 4/5c Control archetype focusing on manipulating the board and interaction. The key concept revolves around utilizing powerful control spells such as Terminus, Swords to Plowshares, and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes card draw and filtering effects like Brainstorm and Ponder to maintain card advantage. Additionally, it includes a combination of land ramp spells and efficient creatures like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to generate value and maintain a strong board presence. The deck also incorporates a companion, Yorion, Sky Nomad, for additional value and versatility.

The main concept of this deck is to combine elements of control and aggression. It focuses on utilizing cards like Ponder, Brainstorm, and Force of Will to manipulate and control the game state while also employing aggressive creatures such as Murktide Regent, Grief, Orcish Bowmasters, Troll of Khazad-dûm, and Sauron's Ransom to quickly deal damage and overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of Reanimate and Sheoldred's Edict allows for reanimation and removal options. The deck also includes land destruction through Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain the advantage. Overall, it aims to control the game while aggressively pressuring the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of spells and creatures to achieve a powerful and explosive victory. The deck includes cards like Chrome Mox, Simian Spirit Guide, and Lotus Petal to generate mana quickly, allowing for fast and dynamic gameplay. The use of cards like Undercity Informer and Balustrade Spy assists in maximizing card advantage and quickly setting up the win condition. Additionally, there are several powerful combo pieces like Dread Return and Bridge from Below that synergize with the deck's strategy, ultimately leading to victory.

The main concept of this deck is to create a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing the "Canadian Threshold" strategy. The deck aims to control the opponent's resources by utilizing counterspells like Daze and Force of Will, while disrupting their mana base with cards like Wasteland. It also focuses on card advantage by including cards like Mishra's Bauble and Brainstorm. The deck's aggressive element is represented by creatures like Delver of Secrets, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Murktide Regent, which can quickly deal damage and put pressure on the opponent.
